In the Central Sahel, humanitarian aid is a lifeline for millions of people. 

Yet, at the end of last year, only 41% of the funding needed to provide lifesaving assistance was available. https://t.co/gNg2MBRtor via @UNOCHA https://t.co/2Vtt5YyvEG

Food insecurity is soaring across 20 countries & regions.

Conflict, economic shocks, natural hazards, political instability & limited humanitarian access are putting millions of lives at risk, the UN warns. https://t.co/Nt4qPMfNgW

Your everyday choices can help tackle the climate crisis: 

Biking to work 🚲
Switching off lights💡
Buying sustainable fashion 🎽
& more!

Chat with us over @Messenger to get more tips on how you can #ActNow to take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/mezgw4kocS https://t.co/S7FCV6o5xw

Afghanistan: "All doors must be kept open for women and girls: in schools, in the workplace, in the halls of justice & across all aspects of public life."

-- @antonioguterres on the need to ensure an inclusive future for all Afghans. https://t.co/bsWRFdvNRJ https://t.co/Nqf9zR6Q31

We must never forget that the Holocaust could have been prevented. 

Too few spoke out, too few listened – fewer still stood up in solidarity.

-- @antonioguterres urges people to uphold human rights & dignity, on #HolocaustRemembrance Day & every day. https://t.co/Mvpnj7adnC https://t.co/ayePDrp1MT

"I don't like the word tolerance. Tolerance means I'm superior to you. I don't want to be tolerated. I want mutual respect and understanding."

-- Rabbi Arthur Schneier, a Holocaust survivor & human rights activist, on Awake At Night. https://t.co/w4Gtq9EHS1 #HolocaustRemembrance https://t.co/loQ4qHMzUL

Since the creation of the UN, 80+ former colonies comprising 750+ million people have gained independence.  

Learn more about decolonization: https://t.co/70Vjl8ed8E https://t.co/B86JgMLj41

How was the Holocaust possible?
What role did ordinary people play?

The @HolocaustMuseum's "Some Were Neighbours" exhibit examines these & other questions around human behavior, choice & the Holocaust. 
https://t.co/EVlmtjxvyZ #HolocaustRemembrance https://t.co/z8QL1jGXkX

"Afghans now live with different - but no less real - fears than those they faced during decades of war." 

-- @UNAMAnews chief @DeborahLyonsUN expresses concern about worsening human rights situation in Afghanistan. https://t.co/3Hayfbt6tg

On Thursday's #HolocaustRemembrance Day we honour the memory of the six million Jews & millions of others who perished in the Holocaust.

Let us stand united against antisemitism, bigotry and hatred -- today, and every day. https://t.co/Mvpnj7rOMc https://t.co/G49iW9aAh9

"They need peace. 
They need hope. 
They need help. 
And they need it now."

-- @antonioguterres on the urgent need to support the people of Afghanistan. https://t.co/bsWRFdect9 https://t.co/pNx7J74zzj

Cold weather & heavy snow are having a terrible impact on the 1.7 million people living in displacement camps in Syria. 

With more winter weather coming, suffering will only increase.

You can help: https://t.co/x4FXXwDAub via @UNOCHA
 https://t.co/DhqOrDLHLc

For more than 70 years, UN peacekeepers have helped countries affected by conflict around the world create the conditions needed for lasting peace.

More about @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/WMDt3Xr0jE #ServingForPeace https://t.co/5WWiaaMQpU

Somalia: By April, more than 1 million people could be displaced due to drought.

@UNMigration is working to address the acute water needs of displaced people, migrants & vulnerable groups, but says more funding is needed. https://t.co/e8q7bMu7w6

"The frightening human cost of waging war in cities is not inevitable; it is a choice."

-- @antonioguterres calls for respect for international humanitarian law to protect civilians caught up in urban conflict. #NotATarget https://t.co/Q217kle6KV

"The very essence of the work of the UN – for dignity and human rights, for justice and peace – is to give meaning to the pledge of ‘Never Again’."

-- @antonioguterres at #HolocaustRemembrance ceremony at @PESynagogue. https://t.co/0GE5P0XPd9 https://t.co/AF0RUlya89

Amid #COVID19, mobility restrictions, labor shortages, supply disruptions, record debt & rising inflation are weighing on the global economy.

Worldwide economic growth is expected to fall from 5.9% in 2021 to 4.4% in 2022, according to @IMFNews.
https://t.co/gEkAuyV8kW

Syria: Freezing temperatures & heavy snow have turned displacement camps into disaster zones.

UN humanitarians are working to clear roads, repair damaged tents & provide urgently needed items including food, blankets & winter clothing. https://t.co/672gCjV0cY

Computers 🖥️
Off-road vehicles 🚙 
Biometric registration 👆

Afghanistan is spiraling into one of the world's worst humanitarian crises. 

Latest @UNOCHA Humanitarian Response Plan outlines urgent funding needs required to provide lifesaving assistance to those most in need. https://t.co/IThDSsxsRC https://t.co/Fbpif1PQsr

Compared to women, men living with HIV are less likely to know their status and many are not receiving adequate treatment.

@UNAIDS says increasing men's access to & use of HIV services is key for better health. https://t.co/vp0OHRAuRM https://t.co/q6gwnWnWYc

Thousands of undocumented Afghans are returning to the country each day; often amid dire humanitarian conditions.

& many more art forms are powerful unifiers of African culture, reminding us that there is unity in diversity.

Education transforms lives.

But education must also be transformed to meet the challenges of today & tomorrow.

Most plastic waste never fully disappears. It just gets smaller & often ends up in our oceans where fish can mistake plastic particles for food. 

That's how plastic can find its way onto our dinner plates.

🔸6 vs. 16 million people affected by sea-level rise
🔸70% vs. 99% of coral reefs dying
🔸double the likelihood that insects lose half their habitat
